address.data

Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • address.data.AddressBook

  • public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    The AddressBook class represents the growing and shrinking list of address entries by inserting and removing from the database. It also allows for various operation on address entries.
    Since:
    15 April 2016
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Shravya Mahankali

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<AddressEntry> f
      To store all the address entries found when searched through last names.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> id
      List to store the corresponding id of an address entry.
      private java.util.ArrayList<AddressEntry> list
      Declaring list to store AddressEntry objects.
      private int num
      Store total number of address entries found

      void add(AddressEntry ae)
      This method adds AddressEntry object to the list and sorts them on basis of First name
      void clearFindList()
      This method clears the find list.

      This method clears the database before entering the list of address entries.

      This method finds a list of address entries starting from the given alphabets

      This method returns the corresponding id when searched through the address entry

      This method returns the address entry id
      java.util.List getList()
      This method returns the list of address entries
      java.lang.String getName(int AddressId)
      This method returns the Name of the person when searched through the address entry id.
      void insert()
      This method is called when the save button is clicked.
      void Load()
      This method loads the list of address entry from the data base and stores them in the address entry list.
      void remove(java.lang.String address)
      This method removes an address entry and also the corresponding id.
      void setAddressId()
      This method sets id for every address entry by using hashing function on the email

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName(int AddressId)
        This method returns the Name of the person when searched through the address entry id. It is required while displaying the notes of corresponding address entry id.
        Parameters:
        AddressId - address entry id
        Returns:
        the name of the person of corresponding address entry id

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • del

        public void del()
         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                java.sql.SQLException
        This method clears the database before entering the list of address entries. The purpose is ensure that there is no duplicate entries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        SQLException,
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insert

        public void insert()
            throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                   java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called when the save button is clicked. It saves the list of address entry to the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • clearFindList

        public void clearFindList()
        This method clears the find list. This is necessary before a new search.

      • Load

        public void Load()
          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                 java.sql.SQLException
        This method loads the list of address entry from the data base and stores them in the address entry list.

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
